parameters: 'Cuz I... I have the real HER right here!!!
I had a feeling someone like you would come.
You want to pull me outta this place, right?
Tell me! Why are ya' here!!!
Shouldn't you know what's goin' on?
I'm staying put! Right here! Planting my feet right down!
See, I have unfinished business in this river...
And I'm gonna stay as long as it takes for me to deal with it.
Well, you're not making it any easier...
As you may know, I really like puzzles. Love 'em to death.
This love came from someone very special in my life... my mother.
Every Sunday, she would sit me in her lap and we would do the crossword together.
Not to mention those checkers games, or big jigsaws that would take up our entire floor.
Our favorite game, though... that was Marco Polo.
You know, the one where you both get in the water, and one calls out Marco, the other says Polo, and you gotta find each other...
Some people wouldn't call it a 'puzzle', but... those people are losers. It totally is one.
Playing it in that big river downhill from our house... there was nothing better to do!
But I w-want to... I want to let you know about this.
T-then one day... I wanted to play Marco Polo. And start all the way at the bottom of the river.
I was so far away, it was a miracle I could still hear my mom's voice.
Took me half an hour to even get close.
But when that happened... when I went up the river... my mom's voice changed.
Or maybe... I was not hearing it right the whole time.
It sounded... well... it sounded like my dad's voice.
Now, I don't think that was a big issue.
My dad... I saw him sometimes. He seemed nice.
But, yes... as I got closer... I realized it was my dad.
I got up right next to him, and opened my eyes.
I asked him where mom was... and he said...
I asked what he meant. He said I would see her soon anyways.
Then he grabbed my arms... grabbed them real hard. I could feel his nails...
I asked him why he was doing that... and he said:
Then, he pushed me under the water and held me down there for a really long time.
In that moment, I thought of the darndest things.
I thought of the games I played before, and the ones I would never get to play.
But most of all, I couldn't stop thinking about my dad's eyes.
They were wide open, but he was staring right through me.
It's like he was daydreaming... Thinking about a place far, far away.
And then, just like that... I woke up here.
It was lonely at first, but... now I have her... and my puzzles... just like I used to.
Now... the only thing left is to wait for my real mama.
Then, we'll start playing together... and pick up where we left off!
That is why you can't make me leave this place...
This newest 'puzzle' of mine... it has yet to come to an end!
But when you say it like that, it...
I just can't see how I can leave... when my papa is still out there...
I don't know why, but the thought of that... it makes my skin crawl.
I miss her. Miss her a lot.
Can't I just wait here... for them? So I can sort things out?
Is there a place... after this... where I can do that?
Listen, mister... I think I've decided it now.
I'm gonna leave all this. Leave it all behind.
There's better places for me to be!
And I think... I think that...
Well, me staying here... staying all mad and sad...
I have a feeling that is what my papa wanted all along.
I shouldn't let him control me like that...
Mister... I can't thank you enough.
